message.content:
cs.CL, cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with grounded language understanding, which involves integrating complex contextual information obtained via perception. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the natural language processing (NLP) sub-category of computer science, which is cs.CL. Additionally, the paper introduces a new multimodal corpus containing ambiguous sentences coupled with videos that visualize the different interpretations for each sentence. This suggests that the paper may also belong to the computer vision (CV) sub-category, which is cs.CV. The paper also extends a vision model to recognize different interpretations of the same underlying sentence, which suggests that it may belong to the machine learning (ML) sub-category, which is cs.LG. Furthermore, the paper addresses the task of disambiguating sentences, which involves making decisions based on uncertain or incomplete information, suggesting that it may also belong to the artificial intelligence (AI) sub-category, which is cs.AI. Finally, the paper involves information retrieval, as it involves finding the correct interpretation of a sentence given a visual scene, suggesting that it may also belong to the information retrieval (IR) sub-category, which is cs.IR.
